channel.title: 2018 on CAMGDP: Central Asia and Mongolia Gender Data Portal
channel.description: Recent content in 2018 on CAMGDP: Central Asia and Mongolia Gender Data Portal

item.title: FemAgora
item.description: Founded in 2018 in Kazakhstan, FemAgora is dedicated to fostering transnational feminist solidarity in Central Asia. The organization is involved in organization of Kazakhstanâ€™s annual women rights march and the issue of employment of transgender people. FemAgora hosts annual FemAgora Central Asian festival for those involved in feminist, gender-sensitive, and/or women-led work.

item.title: Kazakhstan International Bureau for Human Rights and Rule of Law
item.description: Founded in 2018, Kazakhstan International Bureau for Human Rights and Rule of Law (KIBHR) is a Kazakhstani bureau of human rights. It engages in human rights advocacy, shares relevant reports, and engages in human rights monitoring in Kazakhstan.

item.title: Hook Report
item.description: Founded in 2018, Hook Report is an independent Uzbek media offering coverage of political, economic, art, and cultural news in the country. According to its mission, Hook Report aims to bring quality news coverage using a less traditional and formal approach.

item.title: FemPoint
item.description: FemPoint is grassroots organization for LBT women providing support resources and engaged in advocacy and activism.

item.title: Gender Economics Research Center
item.description: Founded in 2018 with the assistance of the Soros Foundation-Kazakhstan, Gender Economics Research Center (GERC) is a research center at Narxoz University, Almaty. GERC is dedicated to development and coordination of research on gender and economy. The center publishes research articles and reports on the topics of labor market, education, COVID-19 impact, and others.

item.title: SVET
item.description: Founded in 2018, SVET is a Kazakhstani foundation dedicated to helping survivors of gender-based violence and sharing relevant news.

item.title: Tselinny Center
item.description: Founded in 2018 by Kairat Boranbayev, Tselinny Center is dedicated to studying and developing cultural scene in Kazakhstan. The center publishes educational books, hosts art exhibitions, and organizes events.

item.title: Uyat Emes
item.description: Founded in 2018, Uyat Emes is an educational site about sex and relationships for Kazakhstani teenagers and their parents. The mission of the initiative is to help young people become more literate about reproductive health and sexuality.
